High Court.translation[0].definitions[0]: a court of law that is at a higher level than ordinary courts and that can be asked to change the decisions of a lower court
High Court.translation[1].definitions[0]: an important court in London, that deals mainly with CIVIL (=not criminal) cases for England and Wales
A top sportswoman was awarded Â£230,981 damages in the High Court yesterday after being knocked down by a motorcycle.
High Court.translation[1].definitions[1]: an important court in Scotland for criminal and CIVIL cases
A man who was caught in possession of a stolen famous painting has been jailed for 18 months at the High Court in Edinburgh.
